page.title: 01GENERAL AREA,POSTLING,KENT
page.content: This area is situated midway between Ashford & Folkestone & is mostly devoted to farming. The area is most pleasing to the eye with fertile farmland in undulating countryside on the edge of the North Downs and with small scattered communities dotted along the narrow winding lanes. Old and established oak,beech & ash trees in hedgerows & woodland give beautiful scenes. The public have access to the grassy slopes of the Downs by the ancient Pilgrims Way & the North Downs Way, which cross the whole district in a south easterly direction.The area is rich in small springs;it has also the source of the East Stour,which rises from several spout holes near the twelfth century church at Postling.
